responses.rationale: The segment reports the numerical metric 'at least 26 states' using standard descriptive verbs 'found' and 'circulating', without vivid language.
The segment reports numerical metrics ('22 million', '13 million', '18 million') using standard descriptive verbs ('killed', 'correct').
The segment reports numerical metrics ('22 million', '13 million', '18 million') using standard descriptive verbs ('updated', 'correct', 'killed').
The segment reports numerical metrics ('at least one person', '36 dairy herds') using standard descriptive verbs ('confirmed', 'spread'). The qualifier 'likely undercount' is factual.
The segment reports a numerical metric ('one in five milk samples') using standard descriptive verbs ('announced', 'finding', 'had').
The segment reports a numerical metric ('56 percent') using standard descriptive verbs ('reported', 'detected', 'were fatal').
The segment describes the cause of disease spread, not prices, economic data, or other numerical metrics.
The segment reports a numerical metric ('23 states') using standard descriptive verbs ('shows', 'have confirmed').
The segment reports the location of cases, not prices, economic data, or other numerical metrics.
The segment reports a numerical metric ('11.7 million turkeys annually') using a standard descriptive verb ('raises').
The segment reports a numerical metric ('46 million chickens') using standard descriptive verbs ('is', 'had').
The segment reports numerical metrics ('13 million chickens', '305,000 turkeys') using standard descriptive verbs ('accounts for', 'having to kill').
The segment reports numerical metrics ('22 million birds', '1.8 million', '1.9 million') using standard descriptive verbs ('mean', 'have had to kill', 'including').
